definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Chaplet style is fine, I think.
She skated a perfect figure of eight.
sentences.chinese: 她的8字花式溜冰动作堪称完美。

sentences.english: We sought to parry the charateristic soviet lunge with fancy footwork.
sentences.chinese: 我们以花式步法力图避开典型的苏联冲刺。

sentences.english: This piece of music is suitable to strut.
sentences.chinese: 这段音乐适合跳花式慢步舞。

sentences.english: An innovative and highly creative quad packet cut done with nothing but finesse.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个极具创新的花式切牌。

sentences.english: The mosaic pattern on an owl butterfly egg looks like a landing pad.
sentences.chinese: 猫头鹰蝶卵上嵌花式图案看上去好像停机坪。

sentences.english: What is football freestyle to me?
sentences.chinese: 对于我来道花式足球是什么？

sentences.english: There are all kinds of fancy mooncakes on sale during the Mid-autumn Festival.
sentences.chinese: 中秋节期间，各种各样花式的月饼在出售。

sentences.english: The western-style clothing coat chest's pocket may install folds the good floral formula the decoration handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 西装上衣胸部的衣袋可以装折叠好花式的装饰手帕。

sentences.english: She got the highest score in fancy diving.
sentences.chinese: 她在花式跳水中得了最高分。

sentences.english: A bundle of extra "fancy starch" had come in.
sentences.chinese: 一大包额外的“花式浆洗”送了过来。

sentences.english: It is new fancy rather than taste which produces so many new fashions .
sentences.chinese: 是新的花式而非新的趣味产生出如此多的新时尚。

sentences.english: Flavored coffee is sold at gourmet food stores and coffee shops.
sentences.chinese: 花式咖啡可在美食店和咖啡店买到。

sentences.english: Doing fucking triple axels . I know this guy . He's dirty.
sentences.chinese: 跳他妈的花式舞蹈我知道是他干的。

sentences.english: A Back Flip is definitely one of the most difficult tricks to perform.
sentences.chinese: 后空翻绝对是滑雪花式里面难度最大的一个动作。

definition: sequence of movements in martial arts/routine/pattern/standard method
pattern/way of doing sth/trick/(sports) fancy-style (as figure skating etc)
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
(slang) to battle each other in street dancing (derived from Taiwanese 較, which sounds similar to Mandarin 尬[ga4])/(slang) to perform weird dance moves
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to increase followers/to get more fans
branch/stem/stalk/CL:根[gen1]/to block/to hinder/(Tw) interesting, fresh, or amusing subject matter or scenario
to lift up (sth hanging down)/to raise (hem of skirt)/to pull up (sleeve)/to sprinkle (water with cupped hands)
